title: Print Checklist
publication_title: Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">fig. 1 Paul Cézanne  
1874, printed 1920  
Etching in black on ivory laid paper; image/plate: 270 × 215 mm; sheet: 465 × 297 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, Joseph Brooks Fair Collection, 1946.442  
Delteil 13

fig. 2 Portrait: Lucien Pissarro  
1874  
Lithograph in black on ivory wove paper; image: 216 × 284 mm; sheet: 279 × 444 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, anonymous contribution and Joseph Brooks Fair Fund, 1959.53  
Delteil 128

fig. 3 Dead Child  
1874  
Lithograph in black on grayish-ivory China paper; image: 217 × 272 mm; sheet: 308 × 396 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Celia and David Hilliard, 2007.652  
Delteil 129

fig. 4 Woodlands at the Hermitage  
1879  
Aquatint, soft ground etching, and drypoint in black on ivory Japanese paper; image/plate: 220 × 270 mm; sheet: 270 × 358 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, Clarence Buckingham Collection, 1977.490  
Delteil 16 V/V

fig. 5 Landscape Panorama  
1879  
Etching and aquatint in black on white wove paper; image: 113 × 393 mm; plate: 116 × 397 mm; sheet: 161 × 436 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, John H. Wrenn Memorial Collection, 1957.322  
Delteil 17 III/III

fig. 6 The Woman on the Road  
1879, printed 1923  
Aquatint, soft ground etching, and etching, with scraping and drypoint, in black on cream laid paper; image/plate 156 × 209 mm; sheet: 242 × 320 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Gaylord Donnelley, 1971.365  
Delteil 18 IV/IV

fig. 7 Wooded Lane at Pontoise  
1879

1912

The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg in memory of Bessie Kisloff Braude, Esq., 2014.519
